snippet.title: Smart cars on smart roads: problems of control
snippet.description:
* Smart cars on smart roads: problems of control (Citations: 503)
Pravin Varaiya
Key features of one automated intelligent vehicle/highway system (IVHS) are outlined, it is shown how core driver decisions are improved, a basic IVHS control system architecture is proposed, and a design of some control subsystems is offered. Some experimental work is summarized. A system that promises a threefold increase in capacity is outlined, and a four-layer hierarchical control ...
Journal: IEEE Transactions on Automatic Control - IEEE TRANS AUTOMAT CONTR , vol. 38, no. 2, pp. 195-207, 1993

snippet.title: The Amyloid Hypothesis of Alzheimer's Disease: Progress and Problems on the Road to Therapeutics
snippet.description:
* The Amyloid Hypothesis of Alzheimer's Disease: Progress and Problems on the Road to Therapeutics (Citations: 1925)
John Hardy, Dennis J. Selkoe
It has been more than 10 years since it was first proposed that the neurodegeneration in Alzheimer's disease (AD) may be caused by deposition of amyloid beta-peptide (Abeta) in plaques in brain tissue. According to the amyloid hypothesis, accumulation of Abeta in the brain is the primary influence driving AD pathogenesis. The rest of the disease process, including ...
Journal: Science , vol. 297, no. 5580, pp. 353-356, 2002

snippet.title: Clock rate versus IPC: the end of the road for conventional microarchitectures
snippet.description:
* Clock rate versus IPC: the end of the road for conventional microarchitectures (Citations: 435)
Vikas Agarwal, M. S. Hrishikesh, Stephen W. Keckler, Doug Burger
The doubling of microprocessor performanceevery three years has been the result of two factors: more transistors per chip and superlinear scaling of the processor clock with technology generation. Our results show that, due to both diminishing improvements in clock rates and poor wire scal- ing as semiconductordevices shrink, the achievable performance growth of conventional microarchitectures will slow substantially. In this ...
Conference: International Symposium on Computer Architecture - ISCA , pp. 248-259, 2000
